Package com.meepcraft.backbone.api.location

Interface GlobalLocation

  • public interface GlobalLocation
    Represents any global location.
    Author:
    Caleb L. Power

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean equals​(GlobalLocation location)
      Determines whether or not two locations are equivalent.
      org.bukkit.Location getLocation()
      Retrieves the Spigot in-game location on an arbitrary server.
      float getPitch()
      Retrieves the pitch referenced by this global location.
      java.lang.String getServer()
      Retrieves the name of the server referenced by this global location.
      java.lang.String getWorld()
      Retrieves the name of the world referenced by this global location.
      double getX()
      Retrieves the x-value referenced by this global location.
      double getY()
      Retrieves the y-value referenced by this global location.
      float getYaw()
      Retrieves the yaw referenced by this global location.
      double getZ()
      Retrieves the z-value referenced by this global location.

    • Method Detail

      • getLocation

        org.bukkit.Location getLocation()
        Retrieves the Spigot in-game location on an arbitrary server.
        Returns:
        the player's location; not guaranteed to be a reference to the original object

      • getServer

        java.lang.String getServer()
        Retrieves the name of the server referenced by this global location.
        Returns:
        a String denoting the name of the server

      • getWorld

        java.lang.String getWorld()
        Retrieves the name of the world referenced by this global location.
        Returns:
        a String denoting the name of the world

      • getX

        double getX()
        Retrieves the x-value referenced by this global location. X-values denote locations in relation to the map's East and West.
        Returns:
        a double denoting the x-value

      • getY

        double getY()
        Retrieves the y-value referenced by this global location. Y-values denote the height of a player, with a value of 0 denoting the bottom bedrock layer.
        Returns:
        a double denoting the y-value

      • getZ

        double getZ()
        Retrieves the z-value referenced by this global location. Z-values denote locations in relation to the map's North and South.
        Returns:
        a double denoting the z-value

      • getPitch

        float getPitch()
        Retrieves the pitch referenced by this global location. Ranges from [-90, 90], where -90 signifies that a player is facing up, 0 signifies that a player is facing straight ahead, and 90 signifies that a player is facing down.
        Returns:
        a float denoting the pitch

      • getYaw

        float getYaw()
        Retrieves the yaw referenced by this global location. Ranges from (-180, 180], where -90 signifies that the player is facing the East, 0 signifies that the player is facing the South, 90 signifies that the player is facing the West, and 180 signifies that the player is facing the North.
        Returns:
        a float denoting the yaw

      • equals

        boolean equals​(GlobalLocation location)
        Determines whether or not two locations are equivalent.
        Parameters:
        location - the location in question
        Returns:
        true iff the locations are equivalent
